intro: Fagonia sinaica var. pseudocretica, commonly known as the Sinai fagonia, is a shrub native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It is characterized by its small, compound leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is adapted to harsh, dry environments and is often found in rocky soils. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is known for its resilience to drought and high temperatures. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of desert flora.
